title: I have a strange spot on my face. It's raised and red like a pimple but instead of being filled with pus, there is a hole in the middle. What is it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Usually, the only symptom of molluscum contagiosum is the tiny bumps on the skin. These flesh-colored or pearly growths look somewhat like tiny pimples with a central crater. A waxy substance may come out of the bumps when they are squeezed. Bullae are raised, fluid-filled bumps that can result from friction, or conditions like contact dermatitis and chickenpox. Cherry angiomas are common skin growths that can form on most areas of the body. They develop when blood vessels clump together and create a raised, bright-red bump under or on the skin. Go to my Profile and you can find all about Acne Cure and Treatment.

As you have not provided a photograph, I cannot diagnose the lesion. A common, benign possibility that could fit that description is sebaceous hyperplasia. A common cancerous possibility that fits that description is a basal cell skin cancer. You should schedule an appointment with your local dermatologist for evaluation and management. #skincancer #biopsy #dermatologist #stayskinsafe #DrTsipporaShainhouse
